title.narrative: Provision of essential health care services and psychosocial support to conflict-affected population in northern Syria

description.narrative:
In line with priorities established in the Northwest Syria Humanitarian Readiness and Response Plan (31 January 2020), the project will focus on emergency health response as per Allocation Strategic Objective (ASO) 3: Provision of emergency services in and out of camps.
The project will ensure provision of lifesaving and essential primary health care services care and psychosocial support to a total catchment population of approximately 36,000 conflict-affected population, including both IDPs (in and out of camp) and Host Communities residents living in Afrin District (indirect beneficiaries). The high rate of arrival of new IDPs in the area is expected to lead to an increase in the catchment population during the implementation of the project.
The project will support continuity of services in one PHC Center in Afrin District, located in Jinderes City Centre. The facility is strategically located in the sub-district receiving the second largest number of new IDPs in Afrin District since 1 December 2019 (40,756 new IDPs as of 23 February 2020).
Since July 2019, the number of IDPs residing in Afrin sub-district has almost tripled and in Jinderes has at least doubled as of February 2020 (CCCM/HNAP data), exacerbating tension with local residents and previously resettled IDPs all facing limited availability of essential services and shelter. Since the first week of February 2020, movement towards northern Aleppo governorate continue to increase due to increasing insecurity in Idlib and Western Aleppo governorates, indicating that more people are seeking to reach safety and services in these areas which will require important preparedness steps across all sectors.
DDD is one of the key health service providers in Afrin District and this project will support emergency preparedness steps to ensure appropriate health service coverage and capacity to increase service availability in case of massive IDP arrival.
The project will allow DDD to scale up and complement the ongoing response implemented by DDD under SCHF 2019 2nd Allocation, focusing on provision of essential PHC and PSS services in Dana sub-district. DDD Emergency Preparedness and Response Plan (Annex 2) includes possible reallocation of health staff and assets from Dana sub-district to Afrin district in order to ensure safety of staff/beneficiaries while maintaining availability of services.
A total of 19,810 individuals are expected to directly benefit from this intervention (direct beneficiaries).
The project will provide life-saving humanitarian assistance to the most vulnerable people to alleviate suffering, in line with HRP 2019 objective 1.
Complementarity with other funding: SCHF Funding will complement additional source of funding currently under negotiation (ECHO) to support the project to be implemented in Afrin.
